ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Changes on Test for all Classes.
ygData.msgSnippet: Not to mention if they actually nerf the Donal s bp, I can see several of our clerics just up and quitting.  While I personally as a Shaman am glad for the
ygData.messageBody:
Not to mention if they actually nerf the Donal's bp, I can see several of
our clerics just up and quitting. While I personally as a Shaman am glad
for the Superior Heal move (the fizzles were quite bad), I dont think it was
the greateest move in the name of class balance. We'll see how it works
out.

Halana, 58th Shaman
Tani, 41st Bardette
Solusek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kenneth E. Bachman [mailto:kbachman@...]
> Sent: Saturday, February 03, 2001 11:35 AM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Changes on Test for all Classes.
>
>
> Regarding the Druid changes:
>
> Add in the probability that they're going to nerf the
> Complete Heal spell (without adequately balancing
> the MOBs to compensate), and you can kiss those Clerics
> goodbye. Sure, give great stuff to the easiest,
> fastest-leveling, most widely played class in the game and
> nerf one of the most one-dimensional boring
> classes to make them overlap even more than they do. That
> sure balances things.
>
> Kenross Cantoforjado, 56 songs, Innoruuk
>
>
> Chris Holden wrote:
>
> > CHANGES ON TEST, FEBRUARY 3, 2001
> > 1) Superior Healing moved to level 51 for shamans and
> druids. casting
> > difficulty reduced
> >
> > 2) New level 55 Druid and shaman spell, Chloroblast,
> similar to remedy for
> > clerics.
> >
> > 3) New Druid spell at level 60, upgrade to superior
> healing, Natures Touch.
>
>
